meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: When Newsweek’s social-media gurus instructed Twitter users to use the hashtag #muslimrage to discuss the magazine’s inflammatory new cover story on Islam, they got more than they bargained for. The hashtag fast became a meme — for Twitter users to mock Newsweek en masse.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PAW2GJ&via=Digg&text=Twitter Rages Against #MuslimRage

div.div: At least selling your soul doesn't leave a mark. Meet the human billboards that sold their skin to companies that don't exist anymore.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QTZnUs&via=Digg&text=Branded For Life

div.a: Are Hospitals More Dangerous Than We Think?

div.div: Bad doctors. Prescription errors. Surgical slips. Medical mistakes injure or kill hundreds of thousands of Americans every year. Why are patients kept in the dark?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U7kKD1&via=Digg&text=Are Hospitals More Dangerous Than We Think?

div.div: Questions for an astronaut who's been literally been living in a cave.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QUdQQb&via=Digg&text=Before They're Astronauts, They're Cavenauts

div.a: If You Have to Take A Leak, Don't Do It Behind The President

div.div: To paraphrase Peter Parker's Uncle Ben, "with the great power to urinate accurately while standing up comes great responsibility." The responsibility to, for example, not just whip it out and take a leak when the President of the United States is right there.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RhY2Ju&via=Digg&text=If You Have to Take A Leak, Don't Do It Behind The President

div.a: Giant Viruses Are Actually Ancient Living Organisms

div.div: A new study has found that giant viruses have some of the most ancient protein structures found in all organisms on the planet.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Uevfo9&via=Digg&text=Giant Viruses Are Actually Ancient Living Organisms

div.a: Where Daniel The Cuckold And Zig Zag Clown Vie For Office

div.div: Batman is running for office in the Brazilian city of Uberlândia. Not one but two James Bonds are seeking city council seats, in Ponta Grossa and Birigui. Elsewhere in Brazil, voters are being urged to cast ballots for candidates with names like Daniel the Cuckold and Elvis Didn’t Die.

li.div: A muncipal election I wish I was covering: In Brazil Ladi Gaga, Christ of Jerusalem and several Batmans vie for office nytimes.com/2012/09/17/wor...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OvfuDQ&via=Digg&text=Where Daniel The Cuckold And Zig Zag Clown Vie For Office

div.a: Could A Drug Dealer Charge More For Better Meth?

div.div: Ever since I started moonlighting in the Breaking Bad TV Club, people have been asking me: Does it really make sense that Walter White has positioned himself as some kind of high-end meth manufacturer? Won’t desperate junkies just settle for anything?

li.div: Of course the most important story of the day is my piece on Breaking Bad and the difficulty of marketing premium meth: slate.com/articles/busines...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RijOgj&via=Digg&text=Could A Drug Dealer Charge More For Better Meth?

div.a: Rat Meat Sold In London Market

div.div: Cane rats and "shocking" quantities of illegal and "potentially unsafe" meat have been sold to the public in east London, BBC London has found.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RZXcLu&via=Digg&text=Rat Meat Sold In London Market

div.a: Google Takes On Instagram, Facebook With Big Acquisition

div.div: Google has agreed to acquire Nik Software, the German developer of photography app Snapseed, for an undisclosed amount.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PzZktM&via=Digg&text=Google Takes On Instagram, Facebook With Big Acquisition

div.div: Comments posted on Twitter and other social-media websites about television shows have exploded in the past year, and it's beginning to have an impact on the writing of shows.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OyV1DI&via=Digg&text=When Twitter Fans Steer TV

div.div: One year ago today, a group of protesters set up camp in Zuccotti Park, a privately owned parcel in New York City, in a protest against America's political and financial system.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RgLLPT&via=Digg&text=365 Days Of Occupy Wall Street

div.div: The Malaysian government has begun organizing seminars aimed at helping parents and teachers identify latent homosexuality in children. One of the principal warning signs? V-neck T-shirts.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PKvwye&via=Digg&text=Malaysia Declares V-Necks Gay

div.a: Romney Caught On Secret Video Dismissing 47% Of Americans

div.div: During a private fundraiser earlier this year, Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney told a small group of wealthy contributors what he truly thinks of all the voters who support President Barack Obama.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PAQDiN&via=Digg&text=Romney Caught On Secret Video Dismissing 47% Of Americans

div.div: Everyone should make it a point to think about something like this at least once a day.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V5gkMt&via=Digg&text=Reddit’s Mind-Blowing Sentences

div.a: Video Shows Libyans Helping Ambassador After Deadly Attack

div.div: An amateur video shows what appears to be a crowd of Libyans taking Christopher Stevens to a safe room—and celebrating that he’s alive.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UfaKYq&via=Digg&text=Video Shows Libyans Helping Ambassador After Deadly Attack

div.a: Why An Open-Source Newsroom Is Harder Than It Looks

div.div: Open-source software might at first seem easy for a news organization to get behind: It’s owned by no one, improved by everyone, and costs nothing to acquire. But after visiting the AJE newsroom this summer, it became apparent the much-heralded open-source movement was a lot more complicated, despite Al Jazeera’s advances.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Qga4y5&via=Digg&text=Why An Open-Source Newsroom Is Harder Than It Looks

div.a: New Study Finds Tax Cuts Don't Lead To Economic Growth

div.div: Does this story prove that raising taxes helps GDP? No. Does it prove that cutting taxes hurts GDP? No. But it does suggest that there is a lot more to an economy than taxes, and that slashing taxes is not a guaranteed way to accelerate economic growth.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Qe8Kfg&via=Digg&text=New Study Finds Tax Cuts Don't Lead To Economic Growth

div.a: Will Science Rule Out The Possibility Of God?

div.div: Although cosmic mysteries remain, Sean Carroll, a theoretical cosmologist at the California Institute of Technology, says there's good reason to think science will ultimately arrive at a complete understanding of the universe that leaves no grounds for God whatsoever.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UfVpH8&via=Digg&text=Will Science Rule Out The Possibility Of God?

div.div: Sean Connery made his last Bond film in 1967, and five men competed to take his place. Check out photos from the casting sessions.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Qgbqvz&via=Digg&text=James Bond Auditions, 1967

div.a: How Tolstoy Learned To Ride A Bike

div.div: Several notable people throughout history have learned remarkable new skills at an advanced age.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PriQZs&via=Digg&text=How Tolstoy Learned To Ride A Bike
